Sustainment: Sustainment Process
   
    Life Cycle and Maturity

The bathtub curve example used is typical for most situations, particularly most electronic and mechanical components that you will be involved with in aircraft and missile related systems. However, not all systems fail in this manner. You want to buy systems that have long useful life. Make sure research shows that your system's life cycle is shaped like a bathtub, not a “V.”

Maturation is a continuous, progressive process designed to improve weapon systems and allow them to continue in use, often well beyond the original expectations when the systems were first acquired. There are several ways to accomplish these objectives.

On the next several pages, you will learn more about three of these objectives: reliability, maintainability and supportability.
